meanings.sent1: The old chair was instable and wobbled when I sat on it.
meanings.sent2: The instable ladder made me nervous to climb up to the roof.
meanings.sent3: The instable table leg caused the whole dinner to shake with every movement.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were as instable as a house of cards, ready to collapse at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The instable ground beneath our feet felt like walking on a tightrope.

meanings.definition: Likely to change or fail; unreliable
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast in spring is quite instable, often changing rapidly.
meanings.sent2: His instable promises left her feeling uncertain about their future together.
meanings.sent3: The instable Wi-Fi connection made it impossible to finish the online exam.
meanings.sent4: The stock market can be as instable as a spinning top, unpredictable and volatile.
meanings.sent5: The instable relationship between the two countries kept the diplomats on edge.
